result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonah R. Vaughn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonah R. Vaughn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from Attorney Richards re sentence credit
revoked

1:31 p.m. Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf306 and 15cf171 (revocation). In 15cf306 - Schiek statement on resolution. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Richards/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Victim Impact statement and restitution statement filed. Victim present in Court.
Court Sentence
Prison - 3-1/2 years - Imposed and Stayed - Initial Confinement - 1-1/2 year; Extended Supervision - 2 years
POP- 3 years
Jail credit - 130 days
Restitution - $1,100 (includes 10%)--actual value of items to be filed within 30 days 
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO. 
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. NADVI given.

In 15cf171 - Schiek/Richards/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing
Court Sentence
Jail - 9 months 
Jail Credit - 51 days
Any unpaid financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment
Adj. 2:01 p.m.
Called briefly with 15cf306 - adj to resolve both cases together
- includes cover letter and revocation summary

Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4:08
state moves to amend count 1 to mis theft -  Granted - Plea questionnaire filed-  No contest plea -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Schiek/Richards/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing- Court WHS and POP For 1 year
CC/CV/Supervision fees/DNA surcharge -Submit DNA sample - 11 days credit if revoked- any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights given
No entry upon any Walmart premises.

1:17 p.m. Court Commissioner Bayne-Allison for Judge Bloom. Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in court via video with attorney Steven G. Richards appearing telephonically with leave of Court.  Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he was at hospital yesterday for birth of daughter. Richards states arrangements were made for voluntary appearance but defendant did not appear - Richards states he was unaware of Defendant's birth of child. Court asks Richards if he has confirmed birth with medical facility - Richards has not. Defendant states child was born on Monday at 12:27 p.m. Bednar states defendant could have appeared or at least contacted his attorney prior to non-appearance; Bednar states that birth does not justify absence from August appearance or any appearance in between. Defendant states he has Wisconsin driver's license and he has a trailer in Oneida County- requests Court's mercy so he can take wife to doctor's appointments.  Court statement to exhausting Court's patience. Defendant requests Waiver of Prelimininary Hearing - Court states that will not be taken up at this time.  Adj. 1:25 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
per Jack @ ONSO - in custody

Attorney Steven G. Richards in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:42
Richards statement to defendant's non appearance - tries to contact defendant - no answer- Warrant to remain active- Court statement to defendant wasting court's time
Voluntary appearance at 11-10-2015 11:30 am
PC from defendant's mother - has been working out of town will be here in November.
States Reply to Discovery    and State's Demand for Discovery
Ralph Conforti
Per Judge O'Melia - ok to refund money to payor of bond
from DA requesting forfeiture of bond - later called back and his intention was to return bond to person that posted -
Amended Extradition Forecast - will extradite
Defendant

11:10 a.m. Attorney Steven G. Richards in court. No appearance by defendant.  Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court speaks to history of the matter. Richards statement. 11:12 a.m. off record. 11:13 a.m. back on record/same parties present. Richard statement/phone call from defendant--on his way/in town. Court grants adj. for a little later this morning. 12:01 p.m. back on record/same parties present; no defendant. Richards statement. Schiek statement - requests warrant; speaks to letter regarding bond. Court orders warrant.
from JA re bond posted
Preliminary hearing at 08-24-2015 11:00 am

03:52 pm - Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in court with attorney John Voorhees appearing on behalf of Steven G. Richards.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 11:00 am.
May not be on Walmart premises

01:48 pm - Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD.  Defendant states moved to Pelican Lake around the 6th of July, living with uncle.  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
